The 'Sapienza University of Rome', officially 'Sapienza â UniversitÃ  di Roma',
also called simply 'Sapienza' [http://www.uniroma1.it/documenti/identita/li-
nee_guida_scrittura.pdf Official Sapienza University of Rome name and logos
writing guidelines] formerly known as 'UniversitÃ  degli studi di Roma "La
Sapienza"', is a coeducational, autonomous state university in Rome, Italy. It
is the largest European university by enrollment and the oldest of Rome's four
state-funded universities. In Italian, [[:wikt:Sapienza|sapienza]] means
"wisdom" or "knowledge".

The largest part of Italian ruling class comes from Sapienza. http://i-
taliadallestero.info/archives/16160 http://www.repubblica.it/pol-
itica/2013/03/16/news/racconto_boldrini-
54693851 http://www.repubblica.it/2007/11/sezioni/scienza_e_tecn-
ologia/curriculum-rodota/curriculum-rodota/curriculum-
rodota.html http://www.altierospinelli.it/altiero_spinelli/index-
.php

Sapienza is present in all major international university rankings. It is among
the best Italian universities. According to the Academic Ranking of World
Universities (Arwu) compiled by the Jiao Tong University of Shanghai, Sapienza
is regularly ranked first among Italian universities along with the University
of Pisa. Sapienza is positioned within the 101-150 group of universities and
among the top 3% of universities in the world. http://en.uniroma1.it/archivionotizie/sapienza-among-top-world-
universities http://www.shanghairanking.com/ARWU2012.html
categories: Educational institutions established in the 14th century
